abstract: Evan Osnos of The New Yorker notes how some Chinese nationalists, nostalgic for Mao, are invoking the Wall Street protests as an alarm bell for the Chinese government over its support of privatization.
snippet: Evan Osnos of The New Yorker notes how some Chinese nationalists, nostalgic for Mao, are invoking the Wall Street protests as an alarm bell for the Chinese government over its support of privatization.
lead_paragraph: The Occupy Wall Street protests appear to have reverberated around the world. Evan Osnos of The New Yorker notes how some Chinese nationalists, nostalgic for Mao, are invoking the Wall Street protests as a warning for the Chinese government over its support of privatization. Read more »

headline.main: Wall Street Protests, Here and Mao
